page.head: Plaque
page.body:
Plaque is a layer of combined saliva, bacteria, and food. It is called a biofilm, because it creates a film of living bacteria on teeth.
The bacteria in the biofilm continue to excrete acid that dissolves your teeth. The film prevents your saliva from washing away the acid, so your teeth do not get a chance to heal the dissolved enamel.
Plaque can cause teeth to change colours. It can cause teeth to become yellow, orange, or brown.
